channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: シカゴ・カブスとシンクレアの合弁会社マーキー・スポーツ・ネットワークが、月額19.99ドルでシカゴ地区のカブス戦などを生中継するストリーミング・アプリを開始（Jon Lafayette/Next TV）
item.description:
Jon Lafayette / Next TV:
Marquee Sports Network, a Chicago Cubs and Sinclair joint venture, launches a streaming app with live Cubs games and more in the Chicago area, for $19.99/month  —  Subscription costs $19.99 a month  —  Marquee Sports Network, the regional sports network joint venture of the Chicago Cubs and Sinclair …

item.title: ダニエル・エクCEO、ポッドキャストの要約や音声広告の生成など、スポティファイが自社製品にAI機能を追加統合する可能性を示唆（Aisha Malik/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Aisha Malik / TechCrunch:
CEO Daniel Ek teases ways Spotify could integrate additional AI functionality into its products, including summarizing podcasts and generating audio ads  —  During the company's second-quarter earnings call this morning, Spotify CEO Daniel Ek teased a few ways the streaming service could introduce additional AI-powered functionality.

item.title: BBCが女子ワールドカップ開幕戦での記者の "不適切 "な質問について謝罪、記者はモロッコのキャプテンにゲイの選手がいるのかと質問した（Matias Grez/CNN）
item.description:
Matias Grez / CNN:
The BBC apologizes for a reporter's “inappropriate” question at the Women's World Cup opener; the reporter asked Morocco's captain if the team had gay players  —  Women's World Cup 2023: Live scores, fixtures, results, tables and top scorers  —  The BBC has apologized for an …

item.title: メール：Xは米国と英国で新しい動画広告のディスカウントを提供し、広告主には支出額に達しない限り検証済みステータスを失うと警告している（ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル）。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Emails: X offers discounts on new video ads in the US and UK and warns advertisers that they will lose verified status unless they reach spending thresholds  —  Social-media site X is offering hefty discounts to lure back ad dollars  —  X Corp. is cutting ad prices as it tries to woo brands back to the Elon Musk-owned platform.

item.title: アルファベット、第2四半期のグーグル広告収入は581.4億ドル、2四半期連続の広告売上減の後、前年同期比3％増（Miles Kruppa/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Miles Kruppa / Wall Street Journal:
Alphabet reports Q2 Google ad revenue of $58.14B, growing 3% YoY after two consecutive quarters of falling ad sales  —  Financial chief Ruth Porat to become Alphabet's president and chief investment officer  —  Google reported a pickup in revenue growth during the most recent quarter …

item.title: YouTubeの第2四半期の広告収入は前年同期比4.4％増の76.7億ドル、予想の74.3億ドルを上回り、3四半期連続の減少から一転（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
YouTube's ad revenue increased 4.4% YoY to $7.67B in Q2, above expectations of $7.43B and a reversal after three consecutive quarters of declines  —  Alphabet, the parent company of Google and YouTube, came in above analyst earnings expectations, with top-line growth of 7%.

item.title: スナップ第2四半期：売上高は前年同期比4%減の$1.07B、予想$1.05B、世界DAUは前年同期比14%増の39.7M、予想3.95M、第3四半期売上高予想は予想を下回る、SNAPは16%以上減少（Jonathan Vanian/CNBC）
item.description:
Jonathan Vanian / CNBC:
Snap Q2: revenue down 4% YoY to $1.07B, vs. $1.05B est., global DAUs up 14% YoY to 397M, vs. 395M est., and Q3 revenue forecast below est.; SNAP down 16%+  —  - Snap's overall sales in the second quarter declined 4% from the $1.11 billion it logged in the previous year during the same period.

item.title: ジェフ・ベゾス、ローレン・パウエル・ジョブズ、アレックス・ソロス、ロマン・アブラモビッチなど、CNN買収のためにジェフ・ザッカーが投資家候補に働きかけているとの情報（Tatiana Siegel/Variety）
item.description:
Tatiana Siegel / Variety:
Sources detail Jeff Zucker's efforts to court potential investors in a bid for CNN, including Jeff Bezos, Laurene Powell Jobs, Alex Soros, and Roman Abramovich  —  Jeff Zucker was breezing through the Faena Hotel in Miami Beach when he spotted David Zaslav across the room.

item.title: ナットウエストCEOのアリソン・ローズ女史が、クーツがナイジェル・ファラージを政治的な理由ではなく、金融的な理由でディバンキングしたとするBBCの誤報を認めた（Sarah Taaffe-Maguire/Sky News）
item.description:
Sarah Taaffe-Maguire / Sky News:
NatWest CEO Dame Alison Rose admits to being the BBC source for an erroneous story that said Coutts de-banked Nigel Farage for financial, not political, reasons  —  NatWest chief executive Dame Alison Rose said she thought she was confirming publicly available information to a BBC reporter …

item.title: 英ガーディアン紙、2023年3月期の売上高は前年比3.4％増の2億6440万ポンド、デジタル読者収入は7.6％増、デジタルが全体の70％を占める（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
The Guardian reports revenue up 3.4% YoY to £264.4M for FY ending March 31, 2023, digital reader revenue grew 7.6%, and digital makes up 70% of total revenue  —  Total revenues were up 3% in the year to 31 March 2023.  —  Guardian Media Group has maintained a four-year run of revenue growth …

item.title: スポティファイのダニエル・エクCEOは、ビデオポッドキャストと「より長編のコンテンツ」をアップロードする「インターネットネイティブ」クリエイターの成長を理由に、ポッドキャスティングの高齢化が進んでいると語る（Jill Goldsmith/Deadline）
item.description:
Jill Goldsmith / Deadline:
Spotify CEO Daniel Ek says podcasting is ageing down, citing the growth of video podcasts and “Internet-native” creators who upload “more longform content”  —  Spotify had its best quarter ever for new additions but revenue fell short of expectations and the music streamer booked …

item.title: ザ・サン紙のヒュー・エドワーズ報道をめぐる国会議員の質問に対し、同紙のEICは、この記事には「掲載前にかなりの精査」があり、裏付けとなる証拠もあったと述べている（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
In response to MPs questions over The Sun's Huw Edwards reporting, its EIC says the story had “significant scrutiny pre-publication” and corroborative evidence  —  MPs wanted to know how The Sun verifies its stories.  —  MPs asked The Sun how it verifies its stories following …

item.title: Threadsに、ユーザーがフォローしている人の投稿を時系列でフィードするオプションが追加された（TechCrunch）。
item.description:
TechCrunch:
Threads adds an option for a chronological feed of posts from people the user follows  —  Meta's text-based social network Threads is rolling out one of the most requested features after its launch — a following feed.  —  In a post on his Instagram Channel, Mark Zuckerberg said that the company …

item.title: 情報筋TikTokは8月上旬に米国でeコマース事業を立ち上げ、消費者に中国製商品を販売する計画（Raffaele Huang/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Raffaele Huang / Wall Street Journal:
Sources: TikTok plans to launch an e-commerce business in the US in early August to sell made-in-China goods to consumers  —  TikTok wants to replicate the success of other popular China-founded shopping platforms Shein and Temu  —  TikTok is launching an e-commerce business in the U.S …

item.title: ネクスター、8月21日付でフォックス配給のマイケル・ビアードを社長兼COOに、フォックス社はビアードの後任にデビッド・エスピノーサを指名（Jon Lafayette/Next TV）
item.description:
Jon Lafayette / Next TV:
Nexstar names Fox distribution head Michael Biard as its president and COO, effective August 21; Fox Corp. names David Espinosa to succeed Biard  —  David Espinosa named president of distribution at Fox  —  Nexstar Media Group named Fox distribution head Mike Biard as president and chief operating officer, effective August 21, 2023.
